sn2.23:8.1: ’“Once in the past, venerable sir, I was a king named Serī, a donor, a philanthropist, one who spoke in praise of giving.
sn2.23:8.2: At the four gates I had gifts given to ascetics, brahmins, paupers, wayfarers, mendicants, and beggars.
sn2.23:8.3: Then, venerable sir, the harem women came to me and said:
sn2.23:8.4: ‘Your majesty gives gifts, but we do not give gifts.
sn2.23:8.5: It would be good if, with your majesty’s assistance, we too might give gifts and do meritorious deeds.
sn2.23:8.7: ‘I am a donor, a philanthropist, one who speaks in praise of giving.
sn2.23:8.8: So when they say,“Let us give gifts”, what am I to say to them?’
sn2.23:8.9: So, venerable sir, I gave the first gate to the harem women.
sn2.23:8.10: There the harem women gave gifts, and my gifts returned to me.
sn2.23:9.1: “Then, venerable sir, my khattiya vassals came to me and said:
sn2.23:9.2: ‘Your majesty gives gifts, the harem women give gifts, but we do not give gifts.
sn2.23:9.3: It would be good if, with your majesty’s assistance, we too might give gifts and do meritorious deeds.
sn2.23:9.7: ’ So, venerable sir, I gave the second gate to the khattiya vassals.
sn2.23:9.8: There the khattiya vassals gave gifts, and my gifts returned to me.
sn2.23:10.1: “Then, venerable sir, my troops came to me …
sn2.23:10.7: So, venerable sir, I gave the third gate to the troops.
sn2.23:10.8: There the troops gave gifts, and my gifts returned to me.
sn2.23:11.1: “Then, venerable sir, the brahmins and householders came to me …
sn2.23:11.7: So, venerable sir, I gave the fourth gate to the brahmins and householders.
sn2.23:11.8: There the brahmins and householders gave gifts, and my gifts returned to me.
sn2.23:12.1: “Then, venerable sir, my men came to me and said:
sn2.23:12.2: ‘Now your majesty is not giving gifts anywhere.
sn2.23:12.3: ’ When this was said, I told those men:
sn2.23:12.4: ‘Well then, I say, send half of the revenue generated in the outlying provinces from there to the palace. There itself give half as gifts to ascetics, brahmins, paupers, wayfarers, mendicants, and beggars.
sn2.23:12.5: ’“I did not reach any limit, venerable sir, to the meritorious deeds that I did for such a long time,

sn2.23:12.7: ’ It is wonderful, venerable sir! It is amazing, venerable sir!
